instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message:
Hi, need help with a Macbook Pro 13", 2012, motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

Board boots and don't detect RAM, have try different known good RAM and nothing.
Board don't have liquid damage, the problem just appears one day, not gradually, no freeze screen or ramdom rebooting before.
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_DDR</SIGNAL> is 1.5 volt
<SIGNAL>PP075_S3_MEM</SIGNAL> also normal
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> also normal

Anything I need to test before thinking is a CPU problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message: Have you tried one RAM stick in one RAM slot at a time? Has to be PC3-12800 RAM btw...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message:
Yes, I tested one RAM slot at a time, the original RAM of the Macbbok is good, tested in another board and works fine.
And yes, my known good memory I use to test is SK Hynix 2GB PC3L-12800S-11-13-C3 and I also tried Samsung 2GB PC3-10600S-09-11-B2, also good, that memory is from other Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with the same board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message:
Check the solders near the corners of the RAM slots.
Resolder them, in any case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message:
2Informaticos, thank you for your reply, I start touching the pins with my tweezers and pins 2 and 6 were loose. So lots of flux and hot air, I saw the solder melt, I ultrasonic the board and now Mem slot B is working, but Mem slot A, don't work, if I put a memory in slot A I get 3 beeps.

Mem Slot A pins go trought the board, so I think I?m having another issue now.  Or still same problem and I have to solder again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message: Double B slot RAM module and don't waste more time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message: Agreed max out slot B and move on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No RAM, 3 Beeps
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply, costumer agreed with 8GB in 1 slot,
You can mark as solved.
